Reviews.Title: “Excellent location at a reasonable price.”
Reviews.Author: PedroMSanchez
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel by chance on the Internet. It is arguably the best value in Barcelona. Located centrally in the Eixample at a walking distance from Plaza Catalunya (20 min.) and at 1 minute walking distance from the nearest tube station. Clean rooms and bathrooms. Friendly and helpful staff and all for 60 E/nt.

Reviews.Title: “Best value in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: TravelinMom201
Reviews.Content: For international US travelers, this is as close to great as you can get in this price range. Modern (ie. new) hotel with comfortable beds, bedding, nice shower/bath with decent water pressure, working elevators, a normal thermostat with a/c and heat, friendly staff and all for under $100euro/nt (booking dot com). No doubt this was the best hotel I've stayed at in Europe to date. (We're pretty good with getting around on Metro lines.)

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough place, small room”
Reviews.Author: travelingman59
Reviews.Content: Room 510 had a very nice sized bathroom that was very nicely appointed. Only drawback was that most of the towels provided were quite threadbare (they really should have been cut up into rags). The room itself was not much bigger than the queen sized bed. That was fine because we were out most of the day walking around Barcelona seeing the sights. Hotel is on a main thoroughfare, but about 10-15 blocks from the main tourist areas. I liked the buffet breakfast, which was optional. Service was friendly and the selections were fresh and plentiful. Paid about $127 a night on a weekend. All in all, I would say that it was not a bad deal. Really liked Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sigrutten
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for three nights. I stayed at the hotel as a part of a group of 20 all taking part in the Baraclona Marathon. It was a nice hotel located in a very quiet street with almost no traffic - I slept like a child all three nights. There were a few cafees and a supermarket close to the hotel. The Rambla is in walking distance from the hotel - about 20 minutes with sore "after marathon-legs", but a metro station is nearby. The cleaning lady was a bit angry but she sure was good at her job; our room was very clean. The breakfast buffet was good and the hotel manager even let us have breakfast half an hour earlier than announced because of the early start of the marathon.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, but far from everything”
Reviews.Author: FelipeRocha
Reviews.Content: The positives: The hotel is quite new, comfortable and modern; the breakfast is amazing, despite a little expensive (try the Santiago cake, incredible); the room is very comfortable, despite a little tiny; the bathroom is very modern and big, almost the size of the bedroom. The negatives: I just see the location as a negative aspect, the hotel is far from the touristic attractions. But, there is a metro station just two blocks from the hotel, the neighborhood is good and there are some supermarkets and restaurants near the hotel. As a resume, it is the kind of hotel that if better located, certainly would be much more expensive.

Reviews.Title: “A good base to explore Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: jaysouthuk
Reviews.Content: The hotel is only a short walk (5mins) from Hospital Clinic station (Line 5). Receptionist was friendly, and handed us a map of the city. We had a terrace room on floor “A” which was just above reception so you could take the lift or the stairs. Room was very nice, just a bit on the small side if anything. Beds were very comfortable. Bathroom was also nice with a “his & hers” sink. Complimentary shower gel, soap, toothbrush etc. . . . Free Wi-Fi in your room if you bring your laptop and also a free safe in the room as well. We had a very nice 3 course evening meal with wine in the hotel for about €20 per person. The only complaint I have is that when we returned to the hotel after a long day shopping in Barcelona centre we arrived back to find that the room had still not been made up at 3.30pm. We asked reception who said housekeeping work until 5pm. The room was made-up shortly afterwards. Would use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for bussines trips”
Reviews.Author: macavigo
Reviews.Content: Being an usual bussines traveller, I'm used to that kind of impersonal hotels. When I was told I was going to stay in Zenit Borrel was not really happy about ubication, cause the area where the hotel is isn't really a place full of amenities... But I was surprised. The room was big enough for me, nothing to complain. Bathroom ok, with free amenities (NH hotels should learn of Zenit)... Free wifi. Ubication was better from what I thought, it has a near tube station, and there are some nice restaurants around to have dinner. So, good hotel, will repeat in next trips.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great find”
Reviews.Author: CRobo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Zenit Borrell hotel for 7 nights in August and had a wonderful time. Situated 5 mins from Hospital Clinic metro station, you do not have far to walk from the station to the hotel. We had a room on the second floor, which was very nice, if not a little on the small side. Bed was incredibly comfortable, so much so, I asked for the manufacturers name (may consider changing my own bed). Room was clean and bathroom a decent size. Not a complaint, but it would have been nice to have tea/coffee making facilities provided in the room. Also a list showing available TV channels and numbers would have been helpful. Did not use the restaurant as there were so many fantastic restaurants nearby and we wanted to try as many as possible during our stay. There is a supermarket on the corner of the street, which sells everything you could possible want (including very reasonable priced chilled Cava) and an amazing bakery 2 mins from the hotel, where you can get pastries to die for. Staff were very helpful. On arrival, I requested an iron and ironing board, which was brought up to our room within minutes. We also had a problem with a damp/mould patch on the bathroom ceiling, which I think was caused by pipe work or leak from the floor above. The hotel was fully booked, but staff dealt with this issue quickly and efficiently (placed a vent cover over unsightly area), which we were happy with. There is free Wi Fi throughout the hotel, with a decent bandwidth, enabling us to check emails and book trips throughout our stay. All in all, a fabulous stay. Would definitely stay here again and recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Not a four star hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheTravellingFamily
Reviews.Content: This hotel in Eixample is conveniently located near the metro Hospital Clinic. I stayed here with my 6-year-old daughter who was happy to find they had Disney Channel on tv. Our room was well-sized but still quite small. Unfortunately there were no coffee and tea making facilities and no iron and ironboard for clothes. The location was quiet, but ventilation-system was noisy despite the fact that I turned it off. Buffet breakfast was ok, not plenty to choose from. When asking for tea I only got a small jug, which was just enough for one cup. Not really satisfying and the taste of the Barcelona-tapwater they used to make tea with wasn't my cup of tea literally. I paid €307 for three nights including breakfast, but I think it's a reasonable price for a clean, quiet and conveniantly located hotel. It could have been a three star hotel, because of the above mentioned lack of facilities. When in Barcelona, don't hesitate to use the metro. We bought the 10-rides card for €8,65 and the system is clear and fast. Stay away from La Rambla. Instead go explore other nice spots like Rambla de Catalunya. I used the Time Out Barcelona app on my phone that I found to be great!! Would love to go back, but will choose another hotel in this nice and safe area!

Reviews.Title: “Delightful find!”
Reviews.Author: thekohs
Reviews.Content: One of the best thing about Zenit is its location. Sure, it's not in the hot spots like Las Ramblas, but it's nice to be a few Metro spots away from the busy areas and relax in a quieter neighborhood. The Metro station is about 5 minute walk away and it's a straight line to the Barcelona sants station, which is on the same line to Camp Nou and Sagrada Familiaria. Aside from the location, the room was small but nice and the beds are comfy. Might want to call in advance to ask for an extra pillow though as the one that they provided in my room was really low. But no worries there, rectified easily. Overall a good place for tourist to stay, particularly if you'd like to stay out of the beaten track.

Reviews.Title: “Ok Hotel very noisy rooms.”
Reviews.Author: mjmusic
Reviews.Content: The hotel is modern and in a good location if you want to get away from the busy end. The staff were pleasant enough, however, the rooms are not sound proofed very well. We were woken on multiple occasions by people moving chairs or dropping things in the middle of the night. Not to mention the group of young guys coming home drunk and yelling and screaming in the hallway. We checked out early and moved to a hotel down the road.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: zak22
Reviews.Content: Good hotel. Modern decor. Approx. 5 euro taxi ride from Las Ramblas. We avoided staying at Las Ramblas area because it is very noisy. Be very, very careful in Las Ramblas. I was pick-pocketed whilst my wallet was in my front pocket. A lady splashed bottled water on back on my head. As I turned to see what was going on, 2 men ran into me. Before I knew what was going on, my wallet was gone! Take minimal amount of money and do whatever you can not to attract the attention of these crooks. Some of the cab drivers are crooks too-they charge more than meter shows! As a result I was not impressed with Barcelona and will avoid it in future.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, clean, quiet hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: vagabondodelmondo
Reviews.Content: If you like the activity and bustle of Las Ramblas, this would not be your choice. We like quiet and calm away from the crowd, so it was perfect for us. I asked for the quietest room and got one with no balcony, but it was absolutely quiet. The staff was very helpful in booking flamenco tickets and giving advice and direction. The hotel is very clean and modern, three blocks to the Metro which takes one all over town, two blocks from bus #41 that goes to Las Ramblas and the beach, and a ten minute walk to the Gaudi architecture on Passeig Gracia. They have a lovely breakfast with eggs, ham, cheese, bread, fruit, cereal and excellent tea and coffee. Comfy beds and pillows. Would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury at a Bargain Price!”
Reviews.Author: topcat27
Reviews.Content: This was such a find! Booked through Expedia worked out at about £50 for a twin room per night and we were so impressed. The concierge were very helpful, the room was spacious and modern and the bathroom was great too. We even had a balcony. The hotel is a good 20 mins walk into the Centre of Barcelona, but dotted along the nearby streets are cafe's, delicatessens selling gorgeous food and lots of gift shops which make the walk in to town a pleasure. Is also close to 2 Metro stations - so no need to worry with taxi's. Cannot recommend this hotel enough - will defintely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: crmcwolf
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights and found the hotel to be clean, modern, and comfortable. The double bed had only one long pillow across the top. I asked for 2 more pillows and received them. There was some water pipe noise and we could hear other doors opening and closing, but overall, noise was not a problem. There was a computer at the front desk for complimentary guest use. We found the front desk staff to be friendly, and very patient with our many transportation questions. When we asked about the Hop On, Hop Off bus, we were offered a voucher that resulted in a 2 euro per person savings. We were also given directions to the Airport bus, which was a 5 or 6 block walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: ConorFi
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week The positive points of the hotels include - the locations is quite good as its a short distance to the city center on the subway. Also the general area is well service with bars and restaurant - the rooms are clean and modern with a balcony What i didn't find great was - i didn't find the staff friendly - breakfast was disorganized most mornings Overall this is a good value for money option but doesn't have any outstanding characteristics

Reviews.Title: “Small but very good room in a nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rueskov
Reviews.Content: Well kept hotel, nice staff, free and fast wifi. Very clean room, nice bath room with all amenities you need, quite small bedroom. Perfect for the price if you don't need more than a bed and a bath.

Reviews.Title: “Everything we hoped for and a bit more”
Reviews.Author: Boslandew
Reviews.Content: Our group of four couples stayed for four nights and thought the hotel was excellent, modern decor throughout. The rooms were medium sized with large comfortable beds, TV with UK channels, an immaculate bathroom and the benefit of the safe in the wardrobe. The towels were changed every day and the sheets every two days. We dined twice in the restaurant from the set menu, €14.95, and thought the food was very good as was the included breakfast. The service throughout was first-rate, at reception, in the restaurant, in the bar and the room-staff. Nothing was too much trouble and everything was done with a smile. We liked the location. a quiet neighbourhood with tree-lined streets, with restaurants, bars and shops within easy walking distance. The hotel was 10/15 minutes walk from the main station or two stops on the Metro to 'Hospital/Clinic', two blocks away. Las Ramblas was seven blocks away and the Old town 30 minutes walk or 15 on the Metro. The Metro itself was excellent, clean, punctual, frequent, well sign-posted, simple ticket purchase. We recommend the T10 ticket at €7.85. You can't ask for much more.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: sameoldg2
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Zenit Borrell during a conference. We decided to attend at the last minute and hotels throughout the city were sold out. There was one room here and I snagged it. The location is great - you're not near all of the tourist chaos but also in walking distance to Gran Via, the Eixample, and the Hospital Clinic Metro. There's a grocery store on the corner, too. The hotel is nicely decorated throughout. It doesn't quite have a boutique hotel look, but nicer than a typical chain. The room was very small, but that's not surprising for Europe (and you won't spend much time inside in Barcelona anyway). My room's window looked into a shaft and therefore didn't get a lot of light. I slept comfortably at night, but if your'e like me and need a nap when visiting Spain, the walls are thin and you'll hear the cleaning crew, people closing their doors, etc during the day. One thing I found strange is the lack of information in the room. I wanted to schedule a wakeup call but couldn't find the number of the front desk anywhere in my room. I ended up calling room service to ask.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: aquaero
Reviews.Content: Reserved a room via booking.com and got breakfast inclusive. perfect location, good value for money, friendly staff, nice breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Fair choice”
Reviews.Author: VTania
Reviews.Content: We were a group of 3 girlfriends, looking for a bit of comfort while visiting the exciting Barcelona. Hotel was difficult to find at first, especially durring 1 night when we decided to walk from downtown to hotel - well, God bless the inventor of GPS.. :) It is located close to the subway, but to downtown you'de have to change trains. Hotel was nice, modern design in-doors, clean, but room (at least ours) was small and with no balcony. Staff was helpfull & nice, internet was decent. i would choose it again, but only if i'd find an offer - regular price is not quite worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Better than my expectations”
Reviews.Author: seiva
Reviews.Content: Good location, just a few blocks from the Ramblas. Room with minibar, safe, balcony, great bathroom. Free wi-fi Internet. Would definetely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BeantownBoss
Reviews.Content: Decent Hotel...Small Rooms but for the price - it was a good stay. There is not much to do and see in the area - but it is very close to the metro. I would try and stay closer if I could get a better price, but the Zenit Borell had the best price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but tiny”
Reviews.Author: DoinaS
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel but tiny rooms, most of them with a view to the back of the hotel and it' s back terrace. We could see cranes from our window. Overall it was good, as we didn't stay much in the hotel and were of to visit Barcelona, breakfast was delicious a lthough it was not very varied. Hope this was helpful, Doina

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, Modern hotel in convenient location - safe neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: WhatMickyEats
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised by the quality of this hotel. We had traveled throughout Europe before and were expecting the typical small rooms with no frills and a tiny bathroom - yet Hotel Zenit Borrell offered us an average size, clean room with large bathroom. We agree with some other reviews that the walls were a little thin, and there was no lock on the door so the maid did enter in on us resting once, but otherwise the front desk staff were very helpful and even held our bags the day we had to check out, since we had a few hours to kill before catching our flight. There is a restaurant in the hotel, but we only ate breakfast once there for 10 Euros each. A bit overpriced so we ate breakfast at the nearby pastry shops each day after that. We took the Metro every day and found the walk very easy to the Hospital Clinic stop (blue L5), and also had no problems with safety walking at night.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: JB_and_Amy
Reviews.Content: The hotel was booked through hotels.com and was much much nicer than would be expected for the price paid. It is slightly further from the centre of Barcelona (Las Ramblas) than most tourist hotels, but the price reflected this and the walk wasn't bad at all. Very luxurious bathroom and very comfortable bed. Small room, but well furnished and very clean, obviously aimed at the business market, but perfectly suited to a city break.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, but tiny room!”
Reviews.Author: lilsnoopy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Zenit Borrell which resides in a more residential neighbourhood. It's a 5 mins walk from the Hospital Clinic metro stop. It is a modern and clean hotel, but two downsides 1) the room was stayed in was tiny (but there are larger rooms) and 2) the walls are extremely thin. Also our second night, the maid knocked on the door and then proceeded to enter immediately to find us sleeping. There was no chain lock or sign available on the door for do not disturb. This was probably a one off occurrance. Otherwise, it was great value for the price we paid and a very clean accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Handy”
Reviews.Author: MichaelEtt
Reviews.Content: Stayed for four nights in the hotel. Its about 20-23 euro from the hotel to the airport in a taxi. The hotel is about 5 mins walk to the nearest metro. There are some nice pastry shops and cafes for breakfast around the hotel. The room was nice and the bed was comfortable - we slept well. I really cant fault any aspect of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, friendly hotel with great restaurant and staff”
Reviews.Author: earthnutvt
Reviews.Content: I spent way more time in this hotel than I normally would due to the fact that I had sprained my ankle. The beds were the most comfortable of any hotel I'd stayed in in a while. The hotel is very new and modern and is impeccably maintained. It has automatic doors and an elevator, which were great for my situation! The restaurant has a great breakfast that includes fresh fruit and cheeses. The dinner menu has a great selection of dishes, including a wonderful prawn salad that I would highly recommend. The staff were very accommodating of my injury and the front desk called us many cabs! (Which arrive really quickly.) The hotel is right on the street and I believe fairly near a metro station. (I couldn't take the metro, so I'm not positive where the station was.) This hotel was a great deal for how great it was. We really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish living in Eixample”
Reviews.Author: Jens74
Reviews.Content: Last year I stayed at a Zenit in Valencia, and Borrell was also very high standard but maybe a bit less 4-star then that. We had a warm welcome and was pleased when there was no problem changing from the first room we got facing a small yard with a tiny window, to another overlooking the street. The room was relaxing, very clean and comfy. Nicely furnished and lot of space. The location is a bit off but as we ends up at the bars in Eixample every night it has it's advantages. And of course a fast free Internet connection is always a plus. There is a few drawbacks. First; the bad lightning in the bathroom, almost impossible to get a clean shave. Second; the restaurant that some Tripadvisor's obviously liked. We had a 3 course meal (different each) and nothing we ate tasted good and we were fairly dissapointed for the cost of 37 euro. Overall a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “The Customer is King”
Reviews.Author: xxSophiaxx
Reviews.Content: It was my birthday and I asked for a room with a balcony - I got one! It was pristine every day. Couldn't ask for more!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: BrendanB
Reviews.Content: This was a really pleasant stay and the hotel is really good - maybe not 4* but definately a very good 3*. We were in room 309 which appeared slightly larger than some other rooms. It was very modern clean and loads of room (the view from the window wasnt much but thats not the reason we went there). This is a good location for a city break in Barcelona which itself is ineresting and loads to do (just be careful with your belongings). I was dissappointed in the standard of food generally in the city but there are loads of choices (try and avoid the main tourist areas for dinner esp down at the Port). If you have booked into the Zenit you should be happy with the hotel - its in a quiet residential area (there is a cafe bar across the street at the corner , when you order a vodka he just pours and forgets to stop). There is a good supermarket 2mins down the street and a really good fruit and veg shop just around the corner. We had room only so didnt eat in the hotel but they did a very good 3 course meal for 15 euro. The location is about 25mins walk to the centre of town - which we didnt mind (took a bit longer on day 1 as we misread the map). There is a metro 5 mins walk away but I love walking in cities stopping off for a coffee on many of the corner cafes so did talk the metro at all. Your only 15mins walk from main train station - do take a day trip to Sitges, less than 6 eurp per person return and 30 mins away. The only place we have ever been that families, older people and a large gay community happily mingle - its a great place for a day at the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, slightly inconvenient for public transport”
Reviews.Author: WBarts
Reviews.Content: Nice modern rooms. The closest metro stop is Hospital Clinic (5 min walk) and for reaching the most popular destination you'll need to change once or twice.

Reviews.Title: “WOW, This hotel was great!!”
Reviews.Author: rkEuroTrip09
Reviews.Content: The room was AMAZING!!! Especially for the price we got!!! Full size tub! Only wierd thing was half a shower door (on purpose). This hotel is a bit far from everything for walking, except the Gaudi stuff, but if you stay really close to one thing you are really far from everything else in Barcelona. The metro is easy, you'll want to use it some any way.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, broken A/C.”
Reviews.Author: ixoye41
Reviews.Content: I thought the staff was very helpful and the cleanliness of the hotel and the rooms was excellent. I did like the fact they had secure underground parking for the guests. On the other hand, my room was very warm... too hot to sleep in really. I had to sleep without any blankets on the bed because it was so hot in the room. The location is decent... it is not close to much of what is interesting to see in Barcelona. I'd prefer a slightly closer metro stop, but 3 blocks away wasn't too bad. I'd probably stay here again if I could get the A/C turned on somehow.

HotelInfo.Address: Conte Borrell 208 | Esquina Calle Mallorca, 08029 Barcelona, Spain
